alert.note: Alert for Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 2:44AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Smith, Franklin and northwestern Webster Counties through 315 AM CST... At 243 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bloomington, or 28 miles northeast of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Riverton around 255 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Campbell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
